intro: Isolepis pygmaea var. sanguinea, commonly known as the blood rush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This variety is distinguished by its bright red or purple flower spikes, which contrast with its grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its striking color and ability to thrive in wet conditions.
